Intervention: A laser treatment administered by a therapist
Laser: laser administered by a therapist
A therapist administered manual lymphatic drainage
Manual lymphatic drainage: massage therapy administered by a therapist
Eligibility: • Survivors of breast cancer will be included if they:
There is a need for professional treatment for phase I or II lymphedema as defined by the International Society of Lymphology;
To have a prescription for the treatment of lymphedema; and
They are ready and able to drive to the study sites.
• Individuals will not be included if they:
- Chemotherapy or intravenous radiation therapy is actively practised;
He has a history of bilateral lymphedema that prohibits the comparison of extracellular fluids with an unaffected limb;
It is impossible to stand to measure height and weight;
At artificial joints in areas where the electrode placement is critical, or has an internal pacemaker/fibrillator; or

- Congestive heart failure (CFD), chronic/acute renal or hepatic disease, pulmonary edema, thrombophlebitis, deep venous thrombosis (DVT), acute infection of any kind and inflammation of the trunk or arms.
Results: As extracellular fluid accumulates (i.e., lymphedema develops), the value of LDex increases.
Timeline: Bioimpedance at the beginning and end of treatment, the average number of treaments being 9 over a median duration of up to 4 weeks.
Title of the arm/group: Laser Therapy Alone
Description of the arm/group: laser treatment administered by a therapist
Laser: laser administered by a therapist
Title of the arm/group: Mld Alone
Description of the arm/group: Therapist administered manual lymphatic drainage
